did.unittitle: Female Cent Society of Bridgehampton, New York records

bioghist.p: The Female Cent Society of Bridgehampton Presbyterian Church was one of many Female Cent societies that were organized in the 1800s. They collected one cent per week for missionary endeavors. The purpose of this organization was to collect "a small sum of money which under the direction of the Presbytery of Long Island shall be applied to the assistance of poor and pious youth in their education for the gospel ministry."

scopecontent.p: The collection is comprised of three volumes. The first volume is a record book which includes minutes, 1815-1844; a list of subscribers; copies of correspondence from other Cent Societies; and addresses by members. Sewn into the volume is a 1985 address given at the Women's Missionary Society of the Presbyterian Church of Bridgehampton, New York, and a manuscript of a sermon given by Dr. Woolworth at the time of the formation of the Female Cent Society of Bridgehampton. The second volume contains the constitution and treasurer's account book, 1821-1836, which details the yearly accounts of the pledges of subscribers of the Society. Volume three is an historical sketch of the society, 1815-1915, compiled by Katharine C. Wright, circa 1916.
